intro: Buceras grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered buceras, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches.
